website_summaries.verdict: The RHA S500i  headphones deliver a bass-forward, yet very bright, sound signature at an affordable price.
pros: Strong audio performance, with robust bass and extra brightness
Comes with a plethora of eartips
Inline three-button remote control and mic
cons: Sculpted sound signature won't appeal to everyone

customer_reviews.title: I liked the sound of these when I first got them
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sound of these when I first got them. There were times that the earbuds didnt seat well impacting the sound. However, if they seat well, or when I swapped to comply, the sound was fairly well balanced and well worth the price. However. I purchased two sets. - One set pulled apart when i was removing/replacing the worn out earbud. RHA did replace under warranty - One set left hand side started playing at about 1/3 to 1/4 the volume of the right side, making them fairly useless. I will be looking for headphones once again.
customer_reviews.author: BrianS

customer_reviews.title: Style over substance...
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this headphone is it encouraged me to spend more money for a better outcome. I like RHA’s sense of style, but these aren’t comfortable or engaging... so while the cool modern look has appeal, I much prefer the comfort and performance of the Westone and Shure’s of the iem world... now I rock some W80s which is a completely different financial performance conversation... but I remember this iem for its disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Julian Rockett

customer_reviews.title: No base!
customer_reviews.text: The buds look good and it looks like good quality however the sound has no base. I use it to block of sounds at night and fall asleep listening music. This earbuds have very bright sharp high tones which doesn’t let me fall asleep and I can’t hear the base. I had cheaper buds before and I was looking forward to have a better one but it’s very disappointing. I will not return because it’s not worth the hassle but I’m going to order my old ones for $13 and call it a day.
customer_reviews.author: cat7510

customer_reviews.title: I really liked these phones--the sound was good
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really liked these phones--the sound was good, the mic was excellent, and the cord was much less prone to getting tangle. But for me, value also depends heavily on DURABILITY and LONGEVITY. And these simply didn't hold up to normal, daily wear and tear. After 4 months of regular use, my right ear-piece came unglued, and before I could look to repair it, the wire became detached, and it was no longer functional. Sorry guys, gotta chalk this up to a design flaw. For $54, I expect better value, and would rather get a cheaper, but more durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Kuhnert

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a pair of RHA and was extremely impressed with the sound quality and fit in the ear. After normal wear and tear my old RHA broke and decided to stay loyal to the brand and repurchase another pair. Unfortunately, the sound quality is no longer as good and the ear buds kept falling out of my ear despite trying on different sizes. I'm a bit disappointed with it might not recommend this anymore to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product & Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Although the first order broke, RHA wrote to remind me it had a 3-yr warranty. They replaced it within a week. My son is super happy and so am I. Outstanding product and even better customer service. Buy these!!!
customer_reviews.author: EnigmaGuy

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound, Quality Materials
customer_reviews.text: After blowing through 3 sets of Apple earbuds, I was ready to try something different. I use my ear buds to listen to music as I work, but also use them to conduct business calls hands-free. The sound quality is outstanding, on both ends, and the array of different sizes allows these to fit any ear size/shape. My favorite part? The braided nylon cord, which to me, is more durable than the rubber casing found on traditional ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: They were OK but ........
customer_reviews.text: Got these about a year and a half ago after reading some solid reviews about them. Sounded pretty good, seemed to distort a bit at times. Two days ago one side stopped working. I have other earbuds that have lasted far longer. I won't be replacing them with an RHA product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud died after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed them for about a month before the left bud died so I'm pretty disappointed in them. I'm not sure if I just received a malfunctioning pair but lasting 1 month isn't a great timeline. According to the warranty, this model should work for 36 months so I've reached out to the company to let them know of my issue. Hoping they provide some productive feedback/suggestions/solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built strong to last long
customer_reviews.text: Extremely good for the price the build quality is by far the best in this price range of under $50 the only problem I felt is that the bass on these are a little too balanced compared to others in this price range I love rap and hip hop and these aren't a good match for those types of music but since these are my gym/work headphones they aren't bad because I really don't concentrate on the music but if your the type that loves you're bass I recommend you look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Wisewo1f

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: They’re pretty good. 👍 Only thing that sucks is that the earbud portion (that separates the actual speaker from the earbud tips) got unglued after around 10 months of usage so I’ve just been gluing it back which seems to be working so far and it hasn’t affected the sound quality. It’s just rather annoying. In terms of sound, I love the sound, and they’re my second favorite (affordable) earbuds thus far (Sony ExtraBass being the top). I bought some mesh earbud tips like some of the reviews recommended and it really does make the sound a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Crista

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted three months
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked fine. Until they didn't. I have gone through two pair of these earbuds since August. Both have blown out one of the earbuds within three months. The cloth casing on the cord is meant to prevent this issue, but instead made it harder to tape and repair. I expected a lot more from $50 ear buds. I've had longer lives from $25 earbuds. Will not be repurchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect them to last very long.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is Meh at best. Construction is cheap. Within a week, one of the earbuds stopped functioning. Waste of money. If they worked properly, would give them a 3 for being average.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Tracy

customer_reviews.title: I have loved these headphones because they fit my small ears so ...
customer_reviews.text: I have loved these headphones because they fit my small ears so well, but after a year the glue that held in the speaker to the metal piece has come lose. Now my $60 earbuds are worthless. RHA makes a great product but it just doesn't stand the test of time. Now I have to search for new earbuds that fit my small ears. I would really appreciate a company rep to talk with I'm not sure how to get in touch with them.
customer_reviews.author: nathaniel shipp

customer_reviews.title: They were great until one side broke
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was great and the cord didnt tangle as much as others. after a few months of use the right ear pierce has gone faint with zero sign of damage or stress. Not happy with the product. look for something better quality that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Denney II

customer_reviews.title: Sound a little "off"
customer_reviews.text: Sound is of course somewhat subjective but in general I found that the Bass was only semi-deep, that there were very sparse mid-tones and an over (exuberance?) of the high end. The result was kinda OK but everytime I put them on I usually noticed how "off" the sound was, but just on the edge of "off".
customer_reviews.author: Thales2112

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Broke first month i had it great support responded within 1 day :) amazing for the price decent bass
customer_reviews.author: Human

customer_reviews.title: best headphones i have ever boughten
customer_reviews.text: best headphones i have ever boughten. Unlike most earphones that say they're noise canceling, this one actually delivers, also comes with a bunch of different earbud heads.
customer_reviews.author: Diego C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound. Good accessories and construction. Excellent ambient noise isolation.
customer_reviews.author: OS

customer_reviews.title: Great buds for the price
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds were purchased to replace a set I had lost that I spent twice as much on, and while the default inserts were a little on the small side the fit was good enough and the sound is great. They are very efficient so volume is not impacted. If I were to lose these I would definitely buy another set. Shipping was fast and the packing was good, no complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Shocked my ear, will not be using any longer.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones look very sleek and clean and have decent sound. However the sharp angled edge is kind of painful as it digs into your ear at times, especially if you're laying down on your side. My biggest gripe is that the left ear piece shocked my ear and it was very painful. I did not expect that to happen AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: broke in less than a mouth!!!! ...
customer_reviews.text: broke in less than a mouth!!!! im rough tho! Although wired headphones only usually last me 3 to 4 months..still a month and the jack connection broke as per my usual wear & tear.
customer_reviews.author: Jered Sodt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: One earpiece stopped working within three months. Not worth your money invest in something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Oh

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, way better than any of the other ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, way better than any of the other earbuds I've tried. Especially the bass is not distorted as it is with all the other less-costly earbuds I've tried. And they're the most comfortable! My only problem is with the volume control; it does nothing to raise or lower the volume.
customer_reviews.author: ni7sh3q

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, bad overall quality. Broken within a year.
customer_reviews.text: After a year, any bending or stretching or even modest touch to the cable results in static sound and harshness. Would not recommend for moderate use, maybe relaxing but not working out, motorcycling, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: Ear Fit?
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a set of earphones or buds that were impossible to fit snugly or even permit changing the ear pieces easily! The quality seems fine but they are unusable in.my case.
customer_reviews.author: DeVee

customer_reviews.title: I have had them for some time now and love the sound and the quality seems really good
customer_reviews.text: Well built earphones. I have had them for some time now and love the sound and the quality seems really good.
customer_reviews.author: Real Conservationist

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a teen
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 18 year old daughter at Xmas based off a review on MSN.com. She loves them. Happy daughter!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Golec

customer_reviews.title: Died 10 months in.
customer_reviews.text: Original: These are excellent! The sound and noise blocking are among the best I've owned. Update: Died out of nowhere in April, sound then nothing. I wrote to the manufacturer because of the warranty. Emailed, got a response, sent my purchase information and heard crickets back. Very dissatisfied, usually the cheap ones have an ear go out, these just silent.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks bass
customer_reviews.text: If you really like bass this is not for you. The mic controls don't work on my iPhone. I'm looking for something with deep bass.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos T.

customer_reviews.title: faulty ear bud
customer_reviews.text: For some odd reason the left ear bud has gone quieter....not sure why or how. Wish that did not happen otherwise they are great ear buds and dont have any issues otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but you really have to push these into ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good but you really have to push these into your ears to get a good seal, and because of this you have to clean them really often. Something about the way they designed the driver. These have a very full sound, but the mids are missing a bit. These are really only good if you're not moving because of the seal needed for proper sound.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound, Build, and Price
customer_reviews.text: Gave these five stars based on: quality of construction, sound, and price point. No frills here, like volume adjust or microphones, just solidly made phones at a great price. First, the construction is great, all metal components, and fabric cord (before the headphones separate, still nice for preventing real nasty knots). Second, sound is exceptional for the price. Nice range, with jazz sounding pretty crisp, and hip hop sounding like hip hop should sound (i.e., that boom bap). Third, they are $40. You basically get skull candies for that, and I break those within a week. These are dope unless you want to talk into the air like a schizophrenic. Plenty of s***e pairs for that.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stafura

customer_reviews.title: sound quality is not bad, i wish it lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: i really did not expect this brand to fail. i used it fo 3 weeks and left ear stopped working. sound quality is not bad, i wish it lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sound is fine, but more than anything
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fine, but more than anything, the remote is super clunky and has quite the lag when skipping tracks. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Amazing response on the Bass notes for the price, very good quality overall
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Alcazar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones, clear, crisp and great bass. Completely blocks all other noise out. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: caroline c

customer_reviews.title: didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. Within 6 months one ear went dead and in less than a year they were dead. In the garbage. Great sound at first but they should have lasted longer at this price point
customer_reviews.author: Chantal Kolber

customer_reviews.title: Worst in the market! Don't buy this! Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: If only there were minus stars! Worst!!! The other half wasn't working! Bought it from Amazon! Disappointed in another level!
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Rahim Omi

customer_reviews.title: Speaker going out in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of these but in less than a months one of the speakers is already cutting out. And I lost them for about a week or two so they really got little use.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Having similar problems as other buyers. Left earpiece got pulled apart and is now held together by only wires. Just put in a warranty claim with RHA.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Earbud stopped working
customer_reviews.text: These were great headphones for a while but after less than a year of use one of the earbuds stopped working :( Super disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality but it's not really durable broke in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality but it's not really durable broke in like a month twice usually I'd have to mess with the wire connected to the auxiliary cord then totally broke
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: They look incredibly nice and sleek but the sound quality was just all ...
customer_reviews.text: They look incredibly nice and sleek but the sound quality was just all right. And since I use my headphones while doing other activities, the noise when the cord rubs against clothing is annoying, especially since it occurs so often.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: First pair pulled apart while replacing ear bud covers. ...
customer_reviews.text: First pair pulled apart while replacing ear bud covers. RHA replaced them promptly. Second pair failed at the plug point with the right channel cutting out.
customer_reviews.author: Swarnali Sengupta

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these earbuds. for the money, they are outta sight!
customer_reviews.author: Heir of Elendil

customer_reviews.title: but overall good sound lacks bass) and built quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't get the remote one it doesn't work and makes this overpriced and in conviant, but overall good sound lacks bass) and built quality.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Great set of ear buds for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great set of ear buds for the money. Company is costumer friendly, I have bought their products in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Trochtenberg

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these headphones, left side audio stopped working after only a couple months of casual listening.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: it simply doesn't get better than this
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable sound and build quality for the price, trust me, it simply doesn't get better than this, also, 3 year warranty just shows off how much trust RHA has put into this.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: The left ear stopped working after having these for less ...
customer_reviews.text: The left ear stopped working after having these for less than one month. Not something I'd expect spending over $50. Learned my lesson and will never purchase from this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Klein

customer_reviews.title: They are of excellent quality as described
customer_reviews.text: They are of excellent quality as described, i love that the material ion which the cable is made does not interfere with the touch screen of my mobile phone. The little details that you notice when you buy something of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: HolyExecutor

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality sound is desent. If sound was better I would give 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Ross E Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Would not reccomend: broke within 2 weeks of owning them
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE- lasted two weeks and as the title states broke within two weeks of owning them..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They were great for the three months that they worked
customer_reviews.text: They were great for the three months that they worked. They died about three months into owning them though.
customer_reviews.author: m luca

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I need. In truth, I just found out that what I like is the type of headphones without remote controls
customer_reviews.author: Yiming Lin

customer_reviews.title: Warning-- Earbud Rubber Tips Stuck in Ear Canals!
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds have good build quality. The low range sounds muffled and loud. They are fine for listening to podcast, but not for classical music. The earbuds are comfortable and stay securely in the ears. Any cable noise can be mitigated by looping the cables around the ears if needed. Noise isolation isn't as good as my older Etymotic earbuds, but it's decent. Update: Earbud rubber tips can get dislodged and stuck in ear canals. They can be very difficult to remove. Never had this problem with 5 sets of Etymotic earbuds. Will not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: CW in LA

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of earbuds with clear and open sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best earbuds I have ever owned. The construction is solid and the earbuds are extremely light and fits my ears perfectly with the proper sized ear pads. The sound stage is very open and clean and the bass is not boomy which is a plus. For people who wants a solidly constructed earbuds along with audiophile quality at at reasonable price, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wang

customer_reviews.title: Questionable construction and lack of durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a gift to my nephew. He loved this phone for the form and fit for his ears and less irritation or pain. However when he tried to change the silicone bud, the whole speaker came off the glue and is hanging by the wires. I will update with picture when i get one
customer_reviews.author: Sur_la_tabla

customer_reviews.title: Defective model - Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.text: Sound great but will break on you quickly. Bought a pair that started to have a horrible sound crackle after about a month of use. Got them replaced for free with the warranty coverage. The second pair broke in about a month again! The wire on it started to come apart and then the left bud stopped working. RHA is a good brand no doubt, I'm just suspecting this model the S500 is DEFECTIVE. Go with another model if getting RHA. I don't think I'll be giving the entire brand a chance again as these are the Cheapest headphones I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: ShoutH2O

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat this deal, they stand up to any earphone in the 100 range. They come with enough ear tips to find a snug fit and I was surprised on how beautiful the design and materials are. I'm no audiophile but the sound is great especially for the size, my daily headphones are V-moda xs but these are definitely my active and on the go set.
customer_reviews.author: gregorio

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: sound quality is pretty good but the product itself doesn't last very long. not worth the $50 imo
customer_reviews.author: JIMMY

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but Poor sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Here are the points: * Sound - Highs are overly loud, mids are washed out, bass is non-existent. I know this is a low-end driver but it's bad. * Comfort - insanely comfortable. * Construction - seems decent. there are some reports of failure. * Controls - Bad... poor tacticle feel, its difficult to find and use the volume down.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo1979

customer_reviews.title: RHA S500
customer_reviews.text: For just $40 these are very hard to beat. They sound really good and are built to last. Plus they come with a 3 year warranty. I sleep with my earphones on every night and I'm very pleased that these are perfect to sleep in. Sound doesn't cut off when I lay on my ears and they're extremely comfortable to wear. I barely notice they're even there!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ear buds on January 12. About a month ago (right after the window to return them closed) the left ear quit working. Last week the right ear quit. I will say they did better at reducing noise than the cheap ones do but they didn't last as long. The volume control never worked and I should have just returned them then but I really needed them for work and didn't think it would be a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin B

customer_reviews.title: The microphone is so so like most. The inclusion of all the tips and ...
customer_reviews.text: As always with RHA I'm content. But not blown away. They do a lot right. The microphone is so so like most. The inclusion of all the tips and carry bag are nice, especially given these are what I consider low end buds. Sound quality is subjective I guess but I found them good (at this price point). I wish they would take a page from other "audiophile" brands and make their cables removable though. But mine haven't broken yet either. If you only have this much to put towards a pair or IEMs I wouldn't feel bad recommending these to you.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Johnston

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality and volume are not as good as the one I used before even though the ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and volume are not as good as the one I used before even though the price is about the same...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but a little overpriced considering the sound quality is not as good as it should, the're not bad at all, I like the sound and the aluminium build quality is great but not really what I expecting for the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Such good sound quality for the price!! Highly recommend! And built well to last.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Nice! But expect shuffling noises.
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, which was the most important feature when I bought these. Docking a star because the cords on these things pick up a LOT of noise. No complaints about anything else; beautiful design, good sound for their size.
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: ... a recommendation on another site and I'm a little disappointed. I've been using these almost everyday for the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these off of a recommendation on another site and I'm a little disappointed. I've been using these almost everyday for the past month and they seem to be just as good as any generic pair of 10 or 15 dollar headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rezvani

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very comfortable. I have difficulty finding earbuds that are small enough for my ears, but I was able to easily find a size given the bud sizes that came with the headphones. Great sound quality also.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: I Was Duped
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Klipsch earbud headphones for years, but decided to give these a try because of the 5-star rating and price. I HATE THEM 1 - They sound tinny 2 - The earbuds are almost impossible to change, because the material that goes over the nub is so small and hard. 3 - The size range of earbuds are not that different. 4 - The base sucks. I would return these, but I was an idiot and put the packaging in the garbage, so it is a little soggy and stinks. I have to admit they are pretty to look at though.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: The sound is good for the high and mid ranges
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are, in my opinion, not worth their price. The sound is good for the high and mid ranges, but the lows are almost non-existent. And the cord noise is the worst I've experienced. If you're planning to use these for anything other than sitting at your computer, don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Your search is over
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have pretty good sound, not the best. The build quality is great, but not the best. But the customer support is amazing. I've been buying headphones every 4-6 months for the last 3 years. I buy them, they break, I email the company, and they never do anything. This time the company actually helped me. They were very polite and quickly issued a replacement pair. If I am ever in need of new headphones this company will be my first choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Reehl

customer_reviews.title: Have to assume that the pair I got were defective.  If they all sound like these they are awful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as an upgrade for my wife's cheap earbuds, based on some very positive reviews. Unfortunately either the pair I got were defective, or they are the worst ear buds I have ever tried. The sound from them when plugged into my iPhone was so thin, tinny and lacking in bass that I just couldn't listen to them. There is nothing wrong with the output from my iPhone as I confirmed by playing the same music through my Sennheiser earbuds. I can only assume that the pair of S500s that I got were defective, and I returned them to Amazon as such.
customer_reviews.author: D. Barry

customer_reviews.title: you'd be hard-pressed to find a better set of buds
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better set of buds.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Very little bass, depth to sound.
customer_reviews.text: Sounded like I was listening to a transistor radio. No depth to the sound. Very dissatisfied. Retuning for something better.
customer_reviews.author: VLS

customer_reviews.title: Best quality headphones under $50
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with Sennheiser CX 300 II. No doubt RHA sounds better. It has more depth to the sound. The bass and treble are outstanding, compared to the CX 300. Great headphones, great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Android User?  Out of luck.
customer_reviews.text: I paid extra for a microphone that doesn't appear to work with Android phones (the center button of the remote does work, but not the volume control). It's really unfortunate that the lack of Android microphone functionality isn't prominently displayed on the Amazon page.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer

customer_reviews.title: BE WARNED YOU WILL HAVE TO PAY FOR RETURN SHIPPING
customer_reviews.text: doesnt have a microphone. given the price, I was shocked sending back immediately (and have to pay shipping fee not happy)
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Rubber coating stripping off
customer_reviews.text: The rubber coating surrounding the wiring has started to strip off. If there is any kind of indentation made on it, such as a fingernail pressing into it, this creates a weak spot in the coating causing it to break and expose the wires underneath. I'm really disappointed in this product considering I have cheaper headphones that don't this.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Andrea K Flores

product_meta.title: RHA S500: Ultra-Compact, Noise isolating Aluminium in-Ear Headphone

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars518 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
